New Records: Kevin Durant scored 32 points and eight rebounds, extending his streak of impactful performances.
The Phoenix Suns achieved a six-game winning streak, a notable milestone in their season.
The Suns shot 50% from the field and 18/43 from three-point range, showcasing their offensive efficiency.
Key Match Events: The Heat missed a potential tying shot in the final seconds, preserving the Suns' lead.
Devin Booker's tying 17-footer and subsequent three-pointer shifted momentum in the fourth quarter.
Tyler Herro's driving layup with 10 seconds left kept the Heat in contention.
Kevin Durant's three-pointer and Jusuf Nurkic's contributions were pivotal in the fourth quarter.
Haywood Highsmith's three-point play brought the Heat within two points late in the game.
Post-Match Reflections: The victory was highlighted as a crucial step toward the championship for the Suns.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Footprint Center, where the Suns have been dominant this season.
This was the 100th meeting between the Phoenix Suns and Miami Heat, a significant historical note.
